definitions.text: a musical notation indicating one half step higher than the note named
a long thin sewing needle with a sharp point
(of something seen or heard) clearly defined
examples: the sharp crack of a twig
the crisp snap of dry leaves underfoot

definitions.text: having or demonstrating ability to recognize or draw fine distinctions
examples: an acute observer of politics and politicians
as sharp and incisive as the stroke of a fang
an astute tenant always reads the small print in a lease
he was too shrewd to go along with them on a road that could lead only to their overthrow

definitions.text: having or emitting a high-pitched and sharp tone or tones

examples: the precipitous rapids of the upper river
the precipitous hills of Chinese paintings

definitions.text: keenly and painfully felt; as if caused by a sharp edge or point
having or made by a thin edge or sharp point; suitable for cutting or piercing
examples: a pencil with a sharp point

definitions.text: (of a musical note) raised in pitch by one chromatic semitone
very sudden and in great amount or degree
examples: a sharp drop in the stock market

definitions.text: changing suddenly in direction and degree
examples: the road twists sharply after the light
her shoes had acutely pointed toes
